article.headline: CS-Northridge 79, Cal Baptist 60
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Joseph Frazier scored a game-high 17 points as Cal State Northridge won its home opener 79-60 over Cal Baptist Tuesday night. Northridge (2-6) shot a blistering 72 percent (18-for-25) in the first half, frequently driving the lane and getting easy baskets in transition on the way to a 43-29 lead at the half. Cal Baptist (8-3), which earlier this season scored an NAIA-record 181 points in a win over the University of Redlands, got no closer than nine points in the second half. Jonathan Heard and Ian Boylan added 12 and 11 points, respectively, for Northridge. Cal Baptist was led by Terrance Johnson and Peter Rajniak, who scored 14 apiece. Gary Holmes added 12. The teams traded baskets in the opening minutes of the game before Northridge took control with a 12-4 run that yielded a 19-10 lead with 9:20 left in the half. Cal Baptist never cut the deficit to any less than seven points after that.
